text: Regulation of the human <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene by the alpha and beta isoforms of the glucocorticoid receptor .

The immunosuppressive effects of glucocorticoids are largely due to transcriptional inhibition of immunologically relevant genes , such as the <extra_id_0> interleukin-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) gene .
These effects are mediated by the intracellular glucocorticoid receptor ( GR ) .

In humans , alternative splicing of the GR precursor mRNA gives rise to two receptor isoforms , termed <extra_id_0> GRalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> GRbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

We previously demonstrated that <extra_id_0> GRbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could antagonize <extra_id_0> GRalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated transactivation of a glucocorticoid - responsive element ( GRE ) - driven reporter gene in COS-7 cells .

The present study was designed to analyze the roles of the two GR isoforms on <extra_id_0> glucocorticoid <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated transrepression of the <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene .

Using a recently developed transfection technique , we demonstrate that in primary human lymphocytes , stimulation of a 548 bp <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter - luciferase reporter construct by phorbol ester and calcium ionophore is reversed by dexamethasone to a similar extent as in Jurkat T lymphoma cells transfected with a <extra_id_0> GRalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression vector .

Transfection of a <extra_id_0> GRbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression vector alone did not result in <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter repression in response to glucocorticoids .

Furthermore , <extra_id_0> GRbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> did not antagonize the repressive effects of <extra_id_0> GRalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> promoter activity .

Surprisingly , overexpression of <extra_id_0> GRbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in Jurkat cells did not cause significant inhibition of <extra_id_0> GRalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced transactivation of a GRE - dependent luciferase reporter gene either .

We conclude that the transrepressive effect of glucocorticoids on <extra_id_0> IL-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene transcription is exclusively mediated by <extra_id_0> GRalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

<extra_id_0> GRbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can neither antagonize <extra_id_0> GRalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated transactivation nor transrepression in Jurkat cells , indicating a cell type - specific pattern of <extra_id_0> GRbeta <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated antiglucocorticoid activity .
